Authors:
Zhangyong Dong, Chaiwat To-anun, Kevin D Hyde, Ratchadawan
Cheewangkoon, Digvijayini Bundhun, Indunil Chinthani Senanayake,
Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena, Erio Camporesi
Title:
First reports of the sexual morphs of Diaporthe forlicesenica
nom. nov. and Diaporthe goulteri (Diaporthaceae, Diaporthales) revealed
by molecular phylogenetics
Keywords:
Diaporthaceae, Diaporthales, Morphology, Phylogeny,
Saprobe, Sordariomycetes
Abstract:
Diaporthe forlicesenica nom.nov. is proposed for D.
dorycnii Dissan., Camporesi & K.D. Hyde, a later homonym of D.
dorycnii (Mont.) Sacc. Diaporthe forlicesenica as well as the species D.
goulteri have so far only been described in their asexual morphs. In
this study, the sexual morphs for these species are recovered for the
first time, from dead branches and twigs in Italy and Thailand. The
sexual-asexual morph connections of the species are confirmed by DNA
sequence based phylogenies including the internal transcribed spacer
(ITS), translation elongation factor-1α (tef1), β-tubulin (tub2),
histone H3 (his) and calmodulin (cal) loci. Detailed descriptions,
illustrations and molecular data for the taxa are provided.
